ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 27 May 1999, Jason Coan wrote:

> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> I hate it when people get twinked out like you. Its people like you that cause the camping problem. Your guildmates camped for their items, which I don't have a problem with, the continued FARMING to get items for guildmates, blah. I've never had a single magic item given to me, I've been there beside my guild buds working to get my items the whole game......ok I shut up now

I totally and wholeheartedly agree with you Jason. All the items that i
have obtained, I have gotten them with my guildmates at my side during
battle. It is people like that, those twinked level 13 chars, that make me
SO frustrated because i cannot even get a goddamn tomahawk axe. I'm level
twenty now, and have been trying with my group to get a tomahawk axe since
level 17. Back then i needed the group to be able to kill the gnoll. Now
i am able to do it solo if i was ever given the chance.

I have been reading all the ideas for what verant should do, and this is
what i think.

Make all items LORE, so you can only have on in your possesion and in
bank.

Make all rare items level specific. If the monster is more than lets say 4
levels above you and your party, you cannot obtain or use the specific
item.

Make all rare items class specidifc, similar to LORE. No offense to
casters, but i'm sick and itred of casters getting warrior only items
SPECIFICALLY to sell them to us. Bullshit.

Nick
